Header: Middle East Ambassadors meet Prime Minister
Content: Ambassadors of the Middle East in Sri Lanka met Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa at Temple Trees. Ambassadors from countries representing the Middle East Ambassadorsâ€™ Forum in Sri Lanka took part in the meeting. The Ambassadors ensured that they will continue to support the new government. The Middle Eastern diplomats also offered their support in all cultural aspects. Ambassadors from Oman, Palestine, Egypt, Kuwait, Libya, Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates were present at the discussion with Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa. Maldivian Foreign Minister Abdullah Saheed called on the Prime Minister. Maldivian Ambassador of Sri Lanka Omar Abdul Razak was also present at the meeting at Temple Trees.
